title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: During his political career, Mélenchon crossed various tendencies of the French left, from Trotskyism in his youth to more moderate socialism, as he was in the Socialist Party for almost thirty years, occupying a place on the left wing of the party, before he began a companionship with the ...

title: Who Is Jean-Luc Melenchon? All About The New Popular Front Leader | Europe - Times Now
snippet: Jean-Luc Melenchon, born on August 19, 1951, in Tangier, Morocco, is the son of a postmaster and a primary school teacher.After working as a teacher for a while, Melenchon entered politics in September 1976 and joined the Socialist Party (PS).

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon, the veteran leftist standing in the way of a Macron-Le Pen rematch
snippet: Like many young leftwingers of ... He got a first job in the press four years later, before starting a 32-year-long association with the Socialist Party in 1976....

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon facts for kids
snippet: In 1976, Mélenchon joined the Socialist Party. He quickly became involved in local politics. He was elected as a town councillor in Massy in 1983. In 1986, he was elected to the Senate, the upper house of the French parliament.

title: Jean-Luc Melenchon | Historica Wiki | Fandom
snippet: Jean-Luc Antoine Pierre Melenchon ... from the University of Franche-Comte to become a teacher, and he joined the Socialist Party of France in September 1976....
